revised_title: Petrology of Igneous and Metamorphic Rocks from Ocean Floor Transform Fault Zones
tldr: This article examines the petrology of igneous and metamorphic rocks from the ocean floor, specifically in transform fault zones and adjacent ridge segments. The authors find that these areas have distinct petrologic contrasts, with transform fault zones containing more plutonic and metamorphic rocks than adjacent ridge crests. The study suggests that fracture zones may provide a window into the deeper zones of the oceanic crust, revealing the composition of the lower crust.
